sentences.en: All this public outpouring is so undignified.
sentences.cn: 所有这些当众宣泄都是很失体面的。

sentences.en: But she could not get over the idea that to earn her living was somewhat undignified.
sentences.cn: 但是尽管如此,她却认为自己谋生糊口有失身份.

sentences.en: He was reluctant to strike such an undignified pose before his girlfriend.
sentences.cn: 他不愿意在女友面前摆出这种有失尊严的姿态.

sentences.en: His skis crossed and he sat down in a most undignified manner.
sentences.cn: 他的滑雪板交叉在一起坐下时,姿势很不雅观.

sentences.en: I had to worm my way out sideways from the bench in a ridiculous, undignified fashion.
sentences.cn: 我侧着身子艰难地从长凳上移开，那个样子很可笑，很不雅观。

sentences.en: It is sad to see a county confine its activities to undignified public bickering.
sentences.cn: 看到整个县都不顾颜面地公开争吵，真让人感到难过。

sentences.en: Some folks might claim these Sunday School fans are undignified and unspiritual and so on.
sentences.cn: 有些人会说,这些热衷于主日学校的人不登大雅之堂,胸无大志,等等.

sentences.en: Some of us find this distasteful - an undignified kind of life.
sentences.cn: 我们一些人对此十分厌恶,认为这是一种极不光彩的生活.

sentences.en: Some of us find this distasteful? an undignified kind of life.
sentences.cn: 我们中的一些人对此很厌恶 —— 认为这种生活方式很不光彩.

sentences.en: Stop all this squabbling, which is most undignified.
sentences.cn: 不要吵来吵去, 有失君子风度.

sentences.en: Such conduct is undignified for a person of his position.
sentences.cn: 对于他这种地位的人来说,这样的行为是不庄重的.

sentences.en: The minister made an undignified retreat from his earlier position.
sentences.cn: 那部长很不光彩地背离了他原先的立场.

sentences.en: There followed an undignified slamming of doors.
sentences.cn: 随后传来了很不像话的摔门声。

sentences.en: There was an undignified scramble for the best seats.
sentences.cn: 大家争抢最好的位子，真是有失体统。

sentences.en: There was an undignified scramble for the free drinks.
sentences.cn: 出现了争抢免费饮料的丢人场面。

sentences.en: They felt it to be undignified to accept a tip.
sentences.cn: 他们觉得接受小费有损尊严.

trans.tran_cn: 不庄严的，无尊严的，有损于尊严的
trans.tran_en: behaving in a way that is embarrassing or makes you look silly
